verse.roman:
ya idaṁ kalya utthāya
mahā-puruṣa-lakṣaṇam
tac-cittaḥ prayato japtvā
brahma veda guhāśayam

synonyms: yaḥ—anyone who; idam—this; kalye—at dawn; utthāya—rising; mahā-puruṣa-lakṣaṇam—the characteristics of the Supreme Personality in His universal form; tat-cittaḥ—with mind absorbed in Him; prayataḥ—purified; japtvā—chanting to oneself; brahma—the Absolute Truth; veda—he comes to know; guhā-śayam—situated within the heart.
translation: Anyone who rises early in the morning and, with a purified mind fixed upon the Mahāpuruṣa, quietly chants this description of His characteristics will realize Him as the Supreme Absolute Truth residing within the heart.
